The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of power market dynamics, a strong quantitative background, and a passion for fast-pac…
description_full:
We are working with a tier 1 systematic hedge fund that is looking to bring on a Quantitative Power Trader to join their trading team focused on the electricity and energy markets. This role blends quantitative research, trading strategy development, and real-time market execution to capitalize on inefficiencies and short-term opportunities in power markets. The ideal candidate will bring a deep understanding of power market dynamics, a strong quantitative background, and a passion for fast-paced, data-driven trading.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and manage systematic and discretionary trading strategies across power markets (e.g., Day-Ahead, Real-Time, FTRs, virtuals, cash)
Develop, implement, and manage systematic and discretionary trading strategies across power markets (e.g., Day-Ahead, Real-Time, FTRs, virtuals, cash)
Conduct in-depth analysis of historical and real-time power market data, including demand forecasts, generation patterns, congestion, and pricing signals
Conduct in-depth analysis of historical and real-time power market data, including demand forecasts, generation patterns, congestion, and pricing signals
Monitor market conditions and adjust strategies dynamically in response to evolving fundamentals and market signals
Monitor market conditions and adjust strategies dynamically in response to evolving fundamentals and market signals
Collaborate with quantitative researchers and engineers to design and refine data pipelines, trading tools, and risk management frameworks
Collaborate with quantitative researchers and engineers to design and refine data pipelines, trading tools, and risk management frameworks
Work closely with the operations team to ensure robust trade execution, compliance, and reporting
Work closely with the operations team to ensure robust trade execution, compliance, and reporting
Stay up to date on regulatory developments, grid operator changes (e.g., PJM, ERCOT, ISO-NE), and fundamental market shifts
Stay up to date on regulatory developments, grid operator changes (e.g., PJM, ERCOT, ISO-NE), and fundamental market shifts
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline
2+ years of experience in power trading, energy markets, or commodities, ideally with exposure to nodal or ISO-based trading
2+ years of experience in power trading, energy markets, or commodities, ideally with exposure to nodal or ISO-based trading
Strong programming skills (e.g., Python, SQL); experience with market data analysis and model development
Strong programming skills (e.g., Python, SQL); experience with market data analysis and model development
Deep understanding of power market structures, locational marginal pricing, and grid operations
Deep understanding of power market structures, locational marginal pricing, and grid operations
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with a strong focus on execution and results
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with a strong focus on execution and results
Experience with optimization, forecasting models, or machine learning in the context of power or commodity markets
Experience with optimization, forecasting models, or machine learning in the context of power or commodity markets
Familiarity with ISO systems such as PJM, ERCOT, MISO, or CAISO
Familiarity with ISO systems such as PJM, ERCOT, MISO, or CAISO

title: Principal Network Systems Engineer
description: Be more than just an employee number Join Terran Orbital, the leader in innovation, manufacturing, and operations in the small satellite industry. We are a pioneer in the miniaturization of space technologies and the delivery of responsive space solutions. We are a unique, fast growing, and trusted team focused on quickly and economically designing, building, launching, and operating state-of-the-art satellites for advanced mission constellations. Terran Orbital is seeking an experienced Princi…
description_full:
Be more than just an employee number! Join Terran Orbital, the leader in innovation, manufacturing, and operations in the small satellite industry. We are a pioneer in the miniaturization of space technologies and the delivery of responsive space solutions. We are a unique, fast growing, and trusted team focused on quickly and economically designing, building, launching, and operating state-of-the-art satellites for advanced mission constellations.
Terran Orbital is seeking an experienced Principal Network Systems Engineer to join our growing team.
In this role, the Principal Network Systems Engineer will ensure that our space vehicle products remain at the forefront of networking and industry standards. This role will implement and maintain robust and effective networking architectures and work closely with our customers and partners to provide a secure and resilient space domain system. You will support the architecture of key elements of mission operations, system functional behavior and performance, and detailed design for innovative, high-capability small satellites.
Key Duties and Responsibilities
Provide technical, engineering, and programmatic support for integrated command and control (C2) space-to-ground and space-to-space network management systems.
Support design, development, and integration, test, and deployment of C2 space-to-ground and space-to-space network management systems
Develop C2 space-to-ground and space-to-space network management systems architectures, standards, requirements, and frameworks.
Monitor and ensure overall systems architecture adherence, and draft/update systems and mission CONOPs with appropriate stakeholders
Support roadmap development for common Software and networking architectures which are modular, scalable, and extensible.
Support integration of mission management and data processing with C2, and integration of other C2 components across all levels of abstraction to enable effective and robust space/ground network management.
Analyze and design for multiple and varying space data transport topologies and CONOPs
Support network calibration, network constellation modeling, data storage and dissemination, precision timing and two-way time and frequency transfer.
Interdisciplinary and collaborative planning, designing, development, verification, and validation of lifecycle balanced product networking solutions.
Establish standard operating procedures that support mission assurance, risk mitigation, and contingency plans to assure required mission “up time” for all ground activities.
Collaborate with engineering teams to define interfaces; integrate mission applications and data storage; and verify Terran Orbital enterprise capabilities
Implement life cycle systems engineering best practices
Requirements
10 years or more of experience in networking and system of systems data transfer
10+ years experience programming C/C++ or similar language
Expertise with computer networking including switch and router networking solutions (packet processing, MPLS, DSCP, VPN, VLAN, IPV4/6, TCP/UDP, Quality of Service, Type of Service, HAIPE NETCONF)
High speed and high reliability networking solutions such as the YANG data model
Embedded systems hardware architecture, processor architecture, and switch/router OS
Expertise in mission technical capabilities, system performance and analysis, and detailed network design.
Demonstrated ability to make complex critical decisions in a timely manner.
Experience leading day-to-day operations on complex programs or large functional organizations, with proven collaboration and coordination skills across internal and external stakeholder organizations.
Experience with risk, issue, and opportunity management
Proven ability to deliver effective communication verbally, written, and through well-crafted presentations across all levels of an organization.
Impeccable attention to detail and sense of urgency
Ability to self-govern with minimal supervision, establish workload priorities, and to utilize efficient time management practices to achieve assigned tasks
To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 22 CFR §120.15 or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State
Additional Differentiators
Hands-on experience developing networking software/firmware implementations for embedded systems. Space or airborne vehicle deployment experience
Demonstrated experience in networking engineering for space domain products
Cryptography and security experience (ex. CISSP or similar security certification)
Demonstrated experience in governance and compliance standards.
Demonstrated experience and success with technical leadership of launched or operational space domain systems and architectures.
Demonstrated experience and success with space-based encrypted communications architectures and devices as well as knowledge of standards for GEOINT and SIGINT data and products
Familiarity with Linux platforms
Benefits
100% Company-paid comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
401(k) Match
Flexible Time Off (FTO)
Salary Range: $160,000-$200,000
Your actual level and base salary will be determined case-by-case and may vary based on the job-related qualification, knowledge, skills, education, and experience. In addition to base salary, we offer 100% covered medical, dental, and vision coverage, a 401(k) match, Flexible Time Off (FTO), covered life insurance, maternity and paternity leave, tuition reimbursement, employee referrals, and lots of swag!
About Terran Orbital
Terran Orbital is a leading manufacturer of satellite products primarily serving the aerospace and defense industries. Terran Orbital provides end-to-end satellite solutions by combining satellite design, production, launch planning, mission operations, and on-orbit support to meet the needs of the most demanding military, civil, and commercial customers. Learn more at www.terranorbital.com
Work Environment
The job operates in a professional office environment but in a manufacturing company. This job routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and scanners.
Disclaimers

title: Senior Software Engineer, Cloud & On Premises Infrastructure
description: Summary Description : Syntiant Corp., a leader in the high-growth AI software and semiconductor solutions space, is looking for an experienced and talented Senior Software Engineer of Cloud & On Premises Infrastructure to take on a critical role with expansive responsibilities and play a leading role in enhancing the Machine Learning function in a growing organization. The Senior Software Engineer of Cloud & On Premises Infrastructure will play a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing our cl…
location_area: US, California, San Mateo County, Redwood City
description_full:
Summary Description:
Syntiant Corp., a leader in the high-growth AI software and semiconductor solutions space, is looking for an experienced and talented Senior Software Engineer of Cloud & On Premises Infrastructure to take on a critical role with expansive responsibilities and play a leading role in enhancing the Machine Learning function in a growing organization.
The Senior Software Engineer of Cloud & On Premises Infrastructure will play a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing our cloud-based applications, specifically those deployed on AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). The ideal candidate will have experience with cloud infrastructure, containerization, and DevOps practices, as well as the ability to work on both on-premises and cloud environments.
Specific Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop, maintain, and optimize RESTful APIs using Python and FastAPI.
Deploy and manage applications on AWS EKS, ensuring high availability, scalability, and performance.
Integrate with various data sources and services (e.g., MongoDB, Postgres) for efficient data storage and retrieval.
Implement CI/CD pipelines to automate testing and deployment processes.
Collaborate with the DevOps team to ensure seamless integration of cloud-native tools and practices.
Maintain on-premises servers running Ceph, PostgreSQL, and NFS services.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues across different environments (development, staging, production).
Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and knowledge sharing sessions.
Requirements
Qualifications, Education, and Experience Required:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in API development.
Hands-on experience with AWS EKS, including deploying, scaling, and managing Kubernetes clusters.
Knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with cloud infrastructure services such as S3, RDS, and VPCs.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools like GitLab CI/CD or Jenkins.
Strong understanding of database systems, including MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MySQL.
Experience with on-premises storage solutions like Ceph and NFS.
Expertise in Linux system administration.
Ability to write clean, maintainable code and perform thorough testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong attention to detail.
Benefits
Benefits Summary:
Medical: Several plan options including PPO and HSA-compatible plans from Anthem Blue Cross, most of which are 100% paid by Syntiant Corp. for you and your family.
Dental: Company-paid dental PPO coverage from MetLife, including coverage for Orthodontia.
Vision: Company-paid vision PPO coverage from MetLife / VSP.
Life Insurance / AD&D: Company-paid basic Life / AD&D coverage in the amount of 3x your salary (up to $1,000,000). Additional supplemental life insurance with low group rates is available for yourself and your family.
Disability Coverage: Company-paid Short Term and Long-Term Disability coverage provides up to 60% income replacement protection.
Spending and Savings Accounts: Flexible Spending Account (FSA) benefits for Health Care and Dependent Care. Health Savings Accounts (HSA) for those enrolled in a qualified Medical plan.
401K Retirement Plan: Administered by Empower, the 401(k) plan allows you to plan for your future by investing a portion of each paycheck.
Other Benefits: A company-provided Employee Assistance Program (EAP), as well as access to additional voluntary benefits including Accident, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Legal Support, and Identity Fraud Protection.
About Syntiant:
Founded in 2017 and headquartered in Irvine, Calif., Syntiant Corp. is a leader in delivering hardware and software solutions for edge AI deployment. The company’s purpose-built silicon and hardware-agnostic models are being deployed globally to power edge AI speech, audio, sensor and vision applications across a wide range of consumer and industrial use cases, from earbuds to automobiles. Syntiant’s advanced chip solutions merge deep learning with semiconductor design to produce ultra-low-power, high performance, deep neural network processors. Syntiant also provides compute-efficient software solutions with proprietary model architectures that enable world-leading inference speed and minimized memory footprint across a broad range of processors. The company is backed by several of the world’s leading strategic and financial investors including Intel Capital, Microsoft’s M12, Applied Ventures, Bosch Ventures, the Amazon Alexa Fund, and Atlantic Bridge Capital. More information on the company can be found by visiting www.syntiant.com.
One element in our total compensation package is base pay. The starting base pay for this role is targeted to be between $180,000 - $230,000. Individual compensation decisions are based on a number of factors, including but not limited to previous experience and skills acquired prior to joining Syntiant, cost of living in the assigned work location, assigned schedule, and salaries of similarly situated peers at the company. It is to be expected that candidates will come to us with different sets of skills and experiences and therefore will be paid at different points in the stated range. We recognize that the person(s) we select for hire may be less experienced or more experienced than the role as posted; if this is the case, any updates to available salary ranges will be communicated with candidates during the recruitment process.

description_full:
Position Title: Network Infrastructure Engineer
Customer: IT Support Service NSWC Port Hueneme Division
Location: Port Hueneme, CA
Clearance Required: Top Secret (preferred)
GC Associates USA (GCA) Website: Home - GC Associates USA (gcassociates-usa.com)
GCA Email for application information: contactgca@gcassociates-usa.com
*Contingent upon contract award*
GC Associates USA requires a highly skilled Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in Cisco-based network infrastructure, security, and VoIP systems. This role requires proficiency in configuring and managing routers, switches, firewalls, IDS/IPS, and related technologies, as well as ensuring the security of network systems in compliance with DISA guidelines. If you are passionate about network design, optimization, and security, we want you to be part of our dynamic team.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage and maintain Cisco layer 2 and layer 3 infrastructure.
Administer and configure firewalls, IDS/IPS, CUCM, VoIP, and Wi-Fi.
Gather cable management requirements and ensure network compliance.
Secure Cisco environments in accordance with DISA Security Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIGs).
Scope, architect, and design new LAN/WAN network infrastructure, including EKMS cryptographic devices and long-haul requirements.
QUALIFICATIONS and EXPERIENCE:
Education: A Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university in an engineering, scientific, business, or technical discipline is required.
Experience: Six years of experience in the Information Technology field that demonstrate experience in:
Cisco layer 2 and layer 3 infrastructure
Firewall, IDS/IPS, CUCM, VoIP, and Wi-Fi administration and configuration
Gathering cable management requirements and ensuring network compliance
Securing Cisco environments in accordance with DISA STIGs
Scoping, architecture, and design of new LAN/WAN network infrastructure, including EKMS cryptographic devices and long-haul requirements
Substitution of Experience for Education: If the candidate does not meet the education and experience requirements, ten years of IT experience can be considered equivalent. Six of those ten years should include experience in the areas listed above. Experience may overlap.

Job Description:
Enters codes to create production data base. Selects and enters codes of utility program to monitor database performance, such as distribution of records and amount of available memory. Directs programmers and analysts to make changes to data base management system. Reviews and corrects programs. Answers user questions. Confers with coworkers to determine impact of data base changes on other systems and staff cost for making changes to data base. Modifies data base programs to increase processing performance, referred to as performance tuning. Workers typically specialize in one or more types of data base management systems. Providing assistance in the planning, development, maintenance, and monitoring of integrated database systems, and ensuring that the conceptual and design phases of new applications are consistent with the structural parameters within the database environment. Evaluates users'; requests for new data elements and systems, incorporates them into the existing shared data environment, and provides technical assistance. Coordinates the use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy, loads databases, and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. Performs logical and physical data modeling, designs relational database models, and creates physical data models from logical data models. Performs security recovery procedures. Determines and implements database search strategies and storage requirements. Maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and sets standards for use of data dictionary. Monitors database performance and recommends efficiency improvements. Creates test database environment for applications section, including the creation of necessary libraries and procedures. Executes the procedures necessary to save, retrieve, and recover databases from hardware and software failures within established procedures. Assists with determining, implementing, and enhancing standards on database security and with monitoring agency disaster recovery procedures and systems. Assists with the installation of database software and with analyzing, designing, and implementing databases. Assists in benchmarking and threshold testing of databases and with establishing and controlling necessary database security. Assists in the selection of database management software. Experience in computer systems analysis or computer programming work. Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of computer programming and systems design; of computer operations, systems, and procedures; of project control and cost estimating techniques; of computer programming languages; of data processing flowcharting techniques; of database structures and theories; and of current database technologies. Has working knowledge of EIR Accessibility standards and assistive technologies. Ensures that user interfaces for database administration and inputting, viewing, outputting data(via reports) are compliant with accessibility standards. Provides support to users in obtaining data / information when EIR Accessibility issues arise.
This individual must meet the general qualifications for the Database Administrator 2 role and adhere to the specifications outlined in this document for the specified customer. The Database Administrator contractor will be a part of the Administrative Applications Production Data Services team, responsible for providing on-call and operational support for critical application databases that feature complex data models, workflows, and reports. Key responsibilities include supporting requests from the Data Warehouse team, monitoring daily and weekly backups, and overseeing database performance and locking issues. The Worker may also be tasked with creating new logical and physical data models. Proficiency in Oracle databases is essential, as the candidate will optimize database performance during and after migration, identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, and implement monitoring solutions to track database health and performance metrics. Collaboration with the team to create and maintain logical and physical data models, particularly focusing on Oracle, is a crucial aspect of this role. Knowledge of Oracle Stored Procedures and Functions is required. Additionally, the position entails generating statistics for all schemas across Production, Development, and UAT databases, as well as performing necessary scripting for database tables. Participation in on-call support is also a requirement of this position.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in Oracle database design, analysis, and performance tuning
Experience in Oracle database structures, data analysis, performance tuning
Required Experience designing enterprise applications and/or services
multi-tier system/application development
Oracle Certification
Please send your resumes to:
vikas.k@eagleiitech.com

SQL Server Database Administrator -Job Description
The Department of Children and Youth (DCY),Office of Information Services (OIS), is seeking an experienced database administratorwho will drive high-caliber database design, solution delivery, and support ina fast-paced and collaborative environment. The successful candidate must be aninfluential technical leader with deep database expertise and a collaborativestyle that promotes a culture of innovation and well managed excellence. We areseeking an experienced SQL Server DBA managing the MS SQL Server environmentsincluding the DB VM servers.
The candidate will be working with otherdatabase administrators across different agencies that manage several databaseplatforms, including (but not limited to) Azure Cloud platform, Oracle Databases.
The SQL Server DBA will beresponsible for managing Microsoft SQL Server Database environments including onthe SQL Server databases virtual machine (VM) servers. They will ensure best practices in databaseplanning, design, configuration, performance and capacity planning and growthensuring our SQL databases offer the highest reliability and performancepossible. They will work with the DBAITM1 to ensure that team goals and metrics are met.
DCY is working with a vendorto migrate a few SQL based applications into the Azure Cloud environment and weneed this DBA to take the lead to learn the applications in the current systemto be able to manage them in the Cloud environment.
Should be able to provide DBA support for distributed servers in a multi-datacenter environment.
Monitor daily activities and performance of complex SQL environment, analyzes technical problems, recommend adjustments, creates, and implements approved solutions using established tools and techniques.
Provide technical assistance to the application development area and co-workers about SQL design and programming.
Configures SQL services (e.g. security, JDBC, clusters). Plans, installs, and coordinates SQL Server releases, migrations, upgrades, and maintenance. Build new environments as needed to support applications.
Coordinating with the teams of network, IIS administrators and storage groups for SQL server-based configurations.
Develop technical documents, project plans and tasks, interact with customers for proposed solutions.
Provide non-production and production support for deploying code and assist in trouble shooting and resolving application issues.
Support DevOps tools (Ansible, Jenkins, Nexis, Mavin, Bitbucket, Kony Mobile, Nginx etc.)
Any other tasks assigned by the management team based on project/application needs.
Provide technical Tier III support, develops project plans with project manager, or recommends approach through defining tasks.
Leading meetings relating to design, implementation, operation, and ongoing maintenance of databases systems.
Designs/plans of cluster nodes hardware selection and recommendations, configures/sets- up cluster nodes, sets-up interconnects, and configures cluster- aware storage; installs cluster and database management system (DBMS) software on all nodes.
Monitoring load balance and tunes cluster parameters for high performance, configuring standby servers.
Configuring and implements log shipping, configures, and implements replication etc.
Provide technical leadership that fosters database innovation and champions automation.
Support strategic planning for database architecture, resource management, and capacity planning and growth.
Ensures best practices in database planning, design, configuration, performance, and resilience.
Evaluate and proposes design and process improvements to achieve performance and cost optimization.
Identify inefficiencies in current database designs and oversees the implementation of improved solutions.
Plans and implements capacity and resource expansion to ensure scalability of databases.
Implements effective risk management controls and owns adherence to all compliance related items (exceptions, waivers, risks, technical compliance, and access control)
Leads incident resolution efforts and engages appropriate resources to complete corrective actions as quickly as possible.
Conducts research and provides recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.
Virtualized Infrastructure running various Unix, Linux, and AIX operating systems.
Altering storage structures to meet the evolving needs of the Organization.
Regularly updating the database security protocols, patching.
Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.
. Willalso work with project management to support and ensure timely and effectiveclient communications about deployments and upgrades.

description_full:
The Opportunity:
IntePros Federal is seeking several talented Senior Agile Coach(s) to support future work for our federal government customer. These people will assist with the creation of a Lean Agile Center of Excellence (LACE). This coach will support Agile Transformation efforts based on the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) values and principles, which play a vital role in supporting the adoption and implementation of Agile methodologies across multiple portfolios. The successful candidate can work across organizational boundaries to facilitate communication and collaboration. Your SAFe Agile expertise will provide coaching, facilitating, mentoring, and teaching to ensure best practices are understood and adapted to align with organizational context and mission requirements.
Clearance: DoD SECRET clearance or above
Locations: National Capital Region (NCR)
**This position is a TELEWORK schedule only for those who reside within the NCR and have the ability to be on-site as needed with the federal customer and program demands, including the ability to work EST business hours of operation.
Role & Responsibilities:
The position will be part of a Team of Agile coaches working together to ensure SAFe practices are consistently applied, refined and adopted across the portfolios. Developing and maintaining the Agile Transformation service offerings to enhance capabilities and understanding of key services such as:
Coaching at the Executive, Portfolio, ART and Team levels
Conducting or observing SAFe Training for all classes
Developing SAFe workshops and customized workshops based on organizational needs
Establishing and supporting Communities of Practice
Performing Agile Assessments aligned with SAFe best practices and Federal standards
Providing ART Launch services
Conducting Value Stream Management services
Advising on DevOps implementation
Conducting LPM/LACE implementation services
Creating and maintaining methods of measuring Agile adoption and implementation of best practices
Implementing tools like Jira, Confluence, etc., to support the LACE efforts
Qualifications:
Required:
Bachelor's degree in technology or related field
5+ years working in an Agile role.
6+ years IT project experience
Bachelor's degree in technology or related field
5+ years working in an Agile role.
6+ years IT project experience
Preferred:
Master's degree in IT or related field
8+ years SAFe Agile experience.
10 years IT project experience.
Federal Government experience.
Master's degree in IT or related field
8+ years SAFe Agile experience.
10 years IT project experience.
Federal Government experience.

ICAgile Certified Professional in Agile Coaching (ICP-ACC)
Additionally, one or more of the following certifications:
SAFe Lean Portfolio Management
SAFe DevOps
SAFe Product Owner/Product Manager
SAFe Scrum Master
SAFe Release Train Engineer
SAFe Agilist (SA6)
ICAgile Certified Professional in Agile Coaching (ICP-ACC)

Kanban Management Professional (KMP)

Who We Are:
IntePros Federal, is a Service-Disabled, Veteran Owned, Small Business (SDVOSB), headquartered in Washington DC, providing IT solutions, systems, and software services to multiple federal government agencies. We specialize in the areas of IT solutions, application development, program management, systems integration, and cybersecurity services. We believe our core values are the keys to success by empowering people to do the right thing for our colleagues, customers, and community. Join Us!!
EEO (Equal Employment Opportunity) Commitment:
This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status or on the basis of disability.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

description_full:
Sr. SailPoint Developer / IAM Engineer - NO RELOCATION - RESTON, VA CANDIDATES ONLY
Join a global team where you will make a direct impact on security and innovation. With a hybrid, flexible work model and a commitment to work-life balance, you'll have the freedom to shape your career while contributing to society.
IMPACT: The Sr. SailPoint Developer / IAM Engineer plays a crucial role in optimizing the company's identity and access management systems. Focused on security, reliability, and efficiency, this role drives the operation and continuous improvement of IAM practices while collaborating with teams to provide expert strategic and operational support.
COMPANY: A $1.5B+ global tech organization who enables the security, stability, and resiliency of key internet infrastructure and services.
OFFERED: At this company, you will enjoy competitive perks like stock options, bonuses, employee stock purchase plan and comprehensive benefits, all while collaborating with top-tier professionals in a dynamic environment. If you're a tech aficionado with a passion for making a difference, this is your chance to shine. Apply now and be part of something extraordinary!
LOCATION: Reston, VA. This is a hybrid (1x/wk in office or less) role available to those who reside within a 60 mile radius.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Utilize strong hands-on skills to take charge of critical systems and lead a team in optimizing and securing the company's IAM solutions.
Develop SailPoint integrations, both custom and out of the box.
Drive the design, implementation, and management of Single Sign-On (SSO) solutions using Ping Identity, shape MFA strategies, and lead SailPoint IGA projects.
Participate in strategic planning, collaboration with cross-functional teams, and assess and implement new technologies.
Create and maintain operational documentation with collaboration tools like Confluence Wiki for systems configurations, operational procedures, and best practices.
May oversee Privileged Access Management (PAM) deployments, ensuring systems are secure and compliant with frameworks like NIST and CIS.
Mentor junior engineers, lead technical teams, and clearly communicate IAM strategies across the organization.
Requirements
IDEAL PROFILE
10+ years in IT with hands-on experience with SailPoint and other IAM technologies.
Proven expertise in developing SailPoint integrations, both out of the box and custom, is required.
Ability to develop integrations with IdPs using protocols like SAML, OAuth, and OIDC is desirable.
Knowledge of authentication/authorization mechanisms like SSO, MFA, PAM, across on-prem, distributed, and SaaS environments, preferred.
Prior experience in core Java development.
Proficiency in Python, PowerShell, Bash, and Ansible.
Experienced with SaaS solutions and cloud environments (AWS, Azure) preferred.
Excellent customer facing skills, able to communicate with others at all levels in the organization.
CERTIFICATIONS (are a plus):
CIAM
CISSP
IAM vendor specific certifications
EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in IT, Business, or related field preferred or equivalent work experience
WORK AUTHORIZATION: US Citizen/Green Card holder preferred. May consider a local H-1B transfer.

description_full:
America-based candidates only
About Reedsy
We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.
We’ve grown to a community of 1,000,000 authors and over 3,000 freelancers in just a few short years, while picking up a number of industry awards along the way
Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!
Job Description
Your role is to offer support to authors, creative publishing professionals (editors, designers, marketers, publicists, ghostwriters, translators, etc.), and optimize conversion.
You will be part of a team of 8. Your role will involve:
Offering support to Reedsy users;
Reviewing projects submitted on the platform;
Building customer funnels (design emails and in-app messages) to reactivate users and introduce Reedsy's features to them;
Maintaining and update our FAQ based on user feedback and questions;
Suggesting product features based on user feedback; and
Contributing to maintaining a high NPS (currently at 86!).
Requirements
Person Specification
5+ years of customer support experience (Intercom, Crisp, Zendesk, etc.)
Experience automating support processes
Great understanding of on-boarding and conversion rate optimization (CRO) techniques
Entrepreneurial minded
Strong writing skills, you can write clearly and accurately, with perfect grammar and spelling
Native-level English speaker
Availability to work every other weekend.
Bonus Points
Previous experience working for a marketplace and/or in a creative industry
Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds.
A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor
Benefits
Work from home;
Paid paternal and maternal leave;
Reedski, our annual ski trip.
Salary range:
$25k – $45k

Job Description: In this role, you will be responsible for designing,…
description_full:
Maverc Technologies is on the lookout for a talented Network Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a leader in providing innovative cyber security and IT solutions, we pride ourselves on our core values of integrity, accountability, and innovation. This role is perfect for individuals looking to make a significant impact in the Cybersecurity and IT sectors while supporting some of the world’s top brands against cyber threats.
Job Description:
In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining efficient network solutions. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring network integrity, availability, and performance while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to support our client’s needs.
Requirements
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Design and implement network infrastructure solutions tailored to customer requirements.
Manage and configure network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, and access points.
Conduct regular network performance analysis and optimization.
Troubleshoot and resolve network issues in a timely manner.
Document network configurations, diagrams, and maintenance procedures.
Work in conjunction with the security team to implement network security protocols.
Participate in network upgrades and provisioning of new services.
Assist in the planning and execution of network migrations and transitions.
To be successful, you should be adaptable, detail-oriented, and ready to tackle challenging problems collaboratively. Good communication skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment are essential.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
5+ years experience in network engineering or a similar role.
Strong knowledge of LAN/WAN technologies and protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF).
Experience with network security practices and devices.
Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or similar are a plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a team setting.
Benefits
**Join Maverc. Be Valued.**
At Maverc, we are an inclusive community where diversity in all its forms is embraced, respected, and recognized as a true asset to the company. We are dedicated to fostering this inclusive environment, though we acknowledge that there is always room for improvement. Maverc is committed to evolving into a more inclusive and equitable organization, upholding the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action.
Maverc is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, age, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristics under federal, state, and local laws.
As a federal contractor, Maverc has implemented affirmative action programs to ensure non-discrimination and promote affirmative action in our policies and practices for qualified women, minorities, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. The narrative portion of Maverc's affirmative action plans is available for inspection at our offices during normal business hours. Employees and applicants interested in reviewing these plans should contact Human Resources at or hr@maverc.com for assistance.
If you are interested in applying for a position with Maverc and require special assistance or accommodation to apply for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department at hr@maverc.com or by calling 888-948-1468.
Exceptional People, Outstanding Benefits
Exceptional people are the cornerstone of any successful company. To attract and retain such talent, Maverc provides fulfilling work opportunities that complement a balanced lifestyle. We achieve this by offering exceptional benefits, enabling our employees to live and work well.
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Training & Development
Work From Home

title: System Administrator

Provide prompt, courteous and effective problem-solving and troubleshooting skills to credit union employees, vendors and/or members when questions or system issues arise. The hiring range for this position is $70,000 - $90,000 annually, exempt plus benefits. Pay…
description_full:
Job Title: System Administrator
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: Chief Information Officer
Job Summary: To support, troubleshoot and maintain computer servers and network, including computer hardware and software systems. Provide prompt, courteous and effective problem-solving and troubleshooting skills to credit union employees, vendors and/or members when questions or system issues arise.
The hiring range for this position is $70,000 - $90,000 annually, exempt plus benefits. Pay is commensurate with experience.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintenance of servers, networks or other systems, including software updates, security patches and routine maintenance tasks.
Ensuring data is backed up regularly and implementing procedures for data recovery in case of a system failure or disasters.
Manage network infrastructure, including switches, firewalls and other network devices to ensure reliable connectivity and performance
Install or modify data communication systems. Provide technical support and consultation in the use and operations of complex computer operating systems.
Respond to user problems on PCs to include software applications, systems integration, or individual hardware problems. Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve the problem.
Provide individual support to end users via the phone, in person, or on-line to answer questions or resolve problems.
Administer phone system and company issued cell phones.
Provide telephone support and perform other administrative duties as needed.
Ensure smooth functioning of IT Systems including repair and monitoring of PCs, printers and other equipment.
Act as a technical resource to assist end users with questions and problems regarding electronic systems, including hardware and software, email, network and other office equipment such as scanners, printers and other related hardware.
Perform general technical support functions including physical installation, assembly, configuration and maintenance of the network, computer hardware and software systems.
Answer and address tickets that are opened via ticketing system.
Research industry trends in technology to ensure the credit union remains competitive in its product and service offerings. Keep abreast of changing trends in technology to include hardware, networks and network tools, software and systems.
Develop configuration and performance standards for the network. Implement and monitor controls to ensure standards are maintained.
Support the credit union's local area and wide area network hardware and software to ensure that back-end functions, systems, PCs, servers, and all peripheral products are operational.
Maintain complete and accurate documentation and support services/warranties for new equipment, software, hardware, and peripherals. Install and test new software both for the network and for individual users.
Research and diagnose IT problems within the entire infrastructure, troubleshoot, and provide solutions. Test solutions to ensure a correct solution.
Escalate system problems to IT team members and/or IT Systems Manager when necessary.
Evaluate and update information and procedures regarding systems and technologies deployed by the credit union.
Professional, well-developed interpersonal skills necessary for serving credit union members and projecting a positive image as a representative of the credit union.
Abides by all policies, procedures, and protocols set forth in the departmental, Unison Credit Union Employee, operational and administrative policy manuals.
Perform all duties in accordance with the credit union's service standards, operations policies and procedures, and in compliance with applicable state and federal laws and regulations.
Identify reportable transactions and activities under the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), its implementing regulations, and Unison's Anti-Money Laundering program. Comply with requirements under Unison's Member (Customer) Identification Program (CIP), FinCEN 314a procedures, and OFAC regulations and sanction programs
An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.
Qualifications:
Advanced server knowledge (Microsoft Windows Server 2019 and 2022), active directory, and group policy knowledge preferred.
Advanced knowledge of Firewalls, VMWare and network.
Advanced knowledge of O365.
Technical knowledge of PC and operating systems.
Self-directed and self-motivated.
Very good organizational skills.
Good analytical thinking skills as well as thorough and detail oriented.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to perform duties and make decisions under sometimes stressful situations.
Must be able to relate well with Information Technology employees as well as with the entire staff and members.
Committed to supporting mission, values and vision.
Professional, well-developed interpersonal skills necessary for serving credit union members and projecting a positive image as a representative of the credit union.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor Degree in Information Systems preferred.
Minimum of 4-6 years work experience in Information System.
Financial experience a plus.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:
Full time employment is approximately 40 hours/week.
Perform additional duties as assigned.
Schedule:
Monday - Friday - Typically 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Additional evening and weekend hours as necessary to accomplish objectives, goals and projects.
Benefits:
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
Life Insurance and Short & Long-Term Disability
Voluntary Life and Dependent Life Insurance
Retirement Plan - Generous Profit Sharing along with 401(k) and Roth options.
PTO/Vacation/Holiday Pay
Employee Assistance Program
Physical and Mental Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to do data entry, stand/walk, bend/stoop/crouch, kneel/push/bend, talk and/or hear. Prolonged sitting throughout the workday to accomplish tasks, occasional travel may be required. Lift and/or carry equipment weighing up to 50 pounds. Corrected vision in the normal range. Hearing within normal range. Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc. May work additional work hours to accomplish tasks. The employee must occasionally drive from his or her home office to different branches. The employee is expected to work in stressful work situations. The physical and mental requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.
Working Environment:
Work is performed in an indoor office environment. The noise level in the work environment is moderate. Travel to different locations in a variety of weather conditions. The work characteristics described here are representative of those individual encounters while performing the essential functions of this position.
Background Check Disclaimer
All applicants who are offer employment with the Company will be subject to a background investigation. Offers of employment are contingent of the successful completion of a background check in accordance with the Company's polices and all applicable laws.

title: YouTube Tech Reviewer / Explainer
description: About OptiSigns OptiSigns is a Houston-based B2B SaaS company that helps more than 22,000 organizations engage customers and employees through intuitive digital-screen solutions. We believe great software should feel effortless—even to non-technical users—and that thoughtful design is as critical as solid engineering. We’re extending that mindset to OptiSigns University , a video-first learning hub that makes every feature click for our users. Why this role exists Our customers learn visually. …
description_full:
OptiSigns is a Houston-based B2B SaaS company that helps more than 22,000 organizations engage customers and employees through intuitive digital-screen solutions. We believe great software should feel effortless—even to non-technical users—and that thoughtful design is as critical as solid engineering. We’re extending that mindset to OptiSigns University, a video-first learning hub that makes every feature click for our users.
Our customers learn visually. We need a creative storyteller who can turn complex workflows into clear, binge-worthy videos that educate, delight, and drive adoption. If you love geeking out on tech, can break things down like a favorite teacher, and enjoy owning the full content-creation stack—from script to final upload—this is your stage.
45 % – Plan & script
• Own the editorial calendar for OptiSigns University (feature tutorials, pro-tips, release rundowns, case studies, webinars).
• Write concise, engaging scripts, outlines, and on-screen text that make every second count.
40 % – Produce & edit
• Capture talking-head and screen-share footage; light, film, and record crisp audio (studio or remote).
• Edit in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve; add motion graphics, callouts, captions, and B-roll.
• Maintain our brand voice, visual style, and accessibility (captions, color contrast, descriptive voice-overs).
10 % – Publish, optimize & engage
• Upload to YouTube, the learning center, and in-app surfaces; craft click-worthy titles, thumbnails, and descriptions.
• Use YouTube Studio & GA4 to track watch-time, retention, and CTA performance—then iterate.
5 % – Collaborate & evangelize
• Partner with product, marketing, and support to stay ahead of upcoming launches and top support tickets.
• Champion video best practices company-wide; coach teammates on on-camera skills when needed.
Requirements
2–5 years creating tech-focused video content (YouTube channel, course platform, or equivalent portfolio required).
Proven on-camera presence and the ability to explain nuanced SaaS features in plain English.
Advanced editing chops in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or Resolve; comfort with screen-capture tools (Camtasia, Loom, OBS).
Strong writing skills—clear, concise, and audience-aware.
Familiarity with motion graphics (After Effects, CapCut, or similar) and thumbnail design (Figma, Photoshop).
Working knowledge of SEO for video (keywords, metadata, chapters, end-screens).
Self-organized: you can juggle multiple projects, hit deadlines, and pivot with product changes.
Empathy for non-technical users and an instinct for simplifying complex workflows.
Bonus points
Experience with hardware, software reviews or B2B SaaS products.
Livestream/webinar production skills (StreamYard, OBS, Restream).
Voice-over, podcasting, or blog-writing chops.
Capability to translate or subtitle content in additional languages.
Benefits
Base salary $60 k – $75 k USD, depending on experience.
10% performance bonus based on KPIs: subscribers, engagement, watch time.
Gear stipend $3 k – $5 k for camera, mic, lighting, teleprompter, and any accessories you need.
Latest MacBook Pro (our standard is M4 Pro 16' - 48GB RAM or equivalent production setup of your choice).
Creative runway—freedom to experiment with live streams, Shorts, webinars, and new formats.
Medical, dental, and vision insurance.
Generous PTO & paid holidays.
Monthly learning stipend (courses, conferences, books).
We review every application personally and respond within a week.
Ready to create videos that empower thousands of businesses every day? Apply now and help us make OptiSigns University the go-to learning hub for digital-signage success.

title: Boomi, Integration Architect
description: At Accellor, we are a trusted digital transformation partner that uses best-of-breed Cloud technology to deliver superior customer engagement and business effectiveness for clients. We’ve created an atmosphere that encourages curiosity, constant learning, and persistence. We encourage our employees to grow and explore their interests. We cultivate an environment of collaboration, autonomy, and delegation – we know our people have a strong work ethic and a sense of pride and ownership over their…
location_area: US, California, Santa Clara County, Santa Clara
description_full:
At Accellor, we are a trusted digital transformation partner that uses best-of-breed Cloud technology to deliver superior customer engagement and business effectiveness for clients.
We’ve created an atmosphere that encourages curiosity, constant learning, and persistence. We encourage our employees to grow and explore their interests. We cultivate an environment of collaboration, autonomy, and delegation – we know our people have a strong work ethic and a sense of pride and ownership over their work. They are passionate, eager, and motivated – focused on building the perfect solution but never losing sight of the bigger picture.
We are seeking highly motivated and accomplished Boomi Integration Architects who encourage an environment where engineers are thought leaders and foster a culture of diversity and inclusion. Acting as leaders across the organization on design, architecture, and best practices, they elevate those around them and push the company forward.
In this role, you will:
Development and implementation of integration solutions using Boomi.
Design, build, and maintain integration processes between various applications, data sources, and cloud services.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand integration requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of integration solutions.
Provide guidance, mentorship, and support to junior developers and team members.
Manage and coordinate project timelines, deliverables, and resources.
Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues and provide ongoing support.
Perform code reviews and ensure compliance with best practices and coding standards.
Develop and maintain technical documentation for integration solutions.
Stay up to date with the latest Boomi features, updates, and industry best practices.
Requirements
Experience & Technical Skills:
Total 10yrs of min experience as an IT professional.
Boomi Expertise: Minimum of 5+ years of hands-on experience in Boomi development and architecture, including API management, EDI integrations, and cloud/hybrid integrations.
Integration Architecture: Strong knowledge of iPaaS (Integration Platform as a Service) principles and best practices, including API-led connectivity, event-driven architecture, and microservices.
Cloud & On-Prem Integration: Experience designing and implementing cloud, hybrid, and on-premises integrations using Boomi AtomSphere.
Data Transformation & ETL: Proficiency in data mapping, transformation, and orchestration across various data sources, including databases (SQL, NoSQL), flat files, and cloud applications.
Enterprise Applications & Protocols: Familiarity with ERP, CRM, HRMS, and other enterprise applications, such as Salesforce, SAP, Workday, NetSuite, Oracle, and Microsoft Dynamics.
API & Web Services: Expertise in designing, implementing, and managing REST, SOAP APIs, and web services.
Security & Compliance: Strong understanding of authentication (OAuth, SAML, JWT), encryption, API security best practices, GDPR, HIPAA, and other compliance requirements.
Performance Tuning & Monitoring: Experience with Boomi monitoring, troubleshooting, debugging, and performance optimization.
CI/CD & DevOps: Familiarity with DevOps methodologies, including CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and deployment automation in integration environments.
Problem-Solving: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex integration challenges with minimal supervision.
Communication & Collaboration: Strong verbal and written communication skills to engage with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Project Leadership: Experience leading integration projects and collaborating with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and enterprise architects.
Agile & SDLC Knowledge: Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments and familiarity with software development life cycle (SDLC) processes.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Boomi Certifications (Preferred): Boomi Associate, Professional, or Architect Certification.
Additional relevant cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, GCP) are a plus.
Experience working with AI/ML-powered integrations in Boomi.
Knowledge of enterprise messaging systems such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.
Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation).
Hands-on experience with data governance, master data management (MDM), and data synchronization across enterprise systems.
Benefits
We strive to offer benefits that support the diverse needs of our employees.
Our package includes perks like flexible and discretionary time off, healthcare coverage for you and your loved ones, and a 401k plan with a company match to help you plan for the future.
Additionally, we offer access to flexible spending and health savings accounts, life and AD&D insurance, and opportunities for professional development.

Location: Seattle, WA

Lead and manage M&A projects from initiation through integration.
Coordinate due diligence efforts across departments including legal, finance, HR, and operations.
Develop and maintain detailed project plans and status reports.
Ensure alignment of business objectives and timelines during integration phases.
Identify and mitigate risks to project delivery and operational continuity.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, including executives.
Requirements Of the Position
5+ years of experience in Project Management with expertise in App Rationalization for a potential merge, sunset or consolidation.
Strong communication and facilitation skills
Work closely with steering committee and IT&S Directors
Address comprehensive inventory of all applications.
Experience in software development life-cycle.

title: HWS Technician
description: Founded in 1995, ESN is a Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB), Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) and Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB). ESN delivers trusted solutions that support our nation's defense. For more than two decades, we have been providing our military and government customers with mission-critical services including engineering and technical support, strategic and program management, testing and evaluation, operations, support, and information technology. We a…
location_area: US, California, Ventura County, Port Hueneme
description_full:
Founded in 1995, ESN is a Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB), Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) and Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB). ESN delivers trusted solutions that support our nation's defense. For more than two decades, we have been providing our military and government customers with mission-critical services including engineering and technical support, strategic and program management, testing and evaluation, operations, support, and information technology. We are committed to proven, repeatable corporate quality management processes and are certified CMMI Maturity Level III - Development/Services & ISO 9001:2015.
We are seeking HWS Technicians.
Located on-site at NWSC PHD in Port Hueneme, CA.
· The contractor shall provide technical support for USN Surface Harpoon Weapon Systems (HWS).
· The contractor shall work closely with the Surface Weapon Engineering branch and the HWS Engineering Leads to provide technical support for USN HWS on tasks associated with Engineering, Logistics, Fleet Support, Distance Support, CASREP Reporting and other HWS In-Service Engineering activities related to HWS lifecycle support.
· The contractor shall attend meetings as assigned.
At least four (4) years of experience operating, maintaining, troubleshooting and testing the Combat/Weapon System equipment.
US Navy certification in Fire Control Navy Enlisted Codes (NECs) related to HWS (preferred), CIWS, RAM or other weapon system.
